```{r rsetup,eval=TRUE,include=FALSE}
require("codecheck")
require("knitr")
require("rprojroot")
require("yaml")
require("xtable")
require("tibble")
require("readr")
options(width = 60)
opts_chunk$set(cache = FALSE)

root <- find_root("codecheck.yml")
```

```{r validate_yaml_syntax, eval=TRUE, include=FALSE}
## Validate YAML syntax - will stop rendering if YAML is invalid
validate_yaml_syntax(file.path(root, "codecheck.yml"))
```

```{r check_certificate_id, eval=TRUE, include=FALSE}
## Check if certificate identifier is set properly and try to update from GitHub
## This will check if the certificate is a placeholder and attempt to retrieve
## the actual certificate ID from GitHub issues matching the author names

# Check if certificate is a placeholder
yml_path <- file.path(root, "codecheck.yml")
if (is_placeholder_certificate(yml_path)) {
  message("CERTIFICATE ID NOT SET")

  # Try to automatically retrieve and update certificate from GitHub
  result <- update_certificate_from_github(
    yml_file = yml_path,
    issue_state = "open",
    apply_update = FALSE  # Set to TRUE to automatically update
  )

  if (!is.null(result$certificate) && result$certificate != "") {
    message("\n✓ Certificate found! To apply the update, run:")
    message("\n  update_certificate_from_github(apply_update = TRUE)")
    message("\nOr manually update codecheck.yml with certificate: ", result$certificate)
  } else {
    message("\nℹ No matching certificate found in GitHub issues.")
    message("You may need to manually set the certificate identifier in codecheck.yml")
  }
}
```

```{r codecheck_logo, echo=FALSE,results='asis'}

```

```{r validate_certificate, echo=FALSE, results='asis'}
## Validate certificate and display warning if placeholder
## Set strict = TRUE to fail rendering if certificate is a placeholder
## Set display_warning = FALSE to suppress the warning box in PDF output
validate_certificate_for_rendering(
  yml_file = file.path(root, "codecheck.yml"),
  strict = FALSE,           # Set to TRUE to fail rendering
  display_warning = TRUE    # Set to FALSE to hide warning in PDF
)
```

```{r manifest, eval=TRUE, include=FALSE}
metadata <- codecheck_metadata(root)
manifest <- metadata$manifest

dest_dir <- file.path(root, "codecheck", "outputs")
## Create the outputs directory if missing
if (!dir.exists(dest_dir) ) {
  dir.create(dest_dir)
}

manifest_df <- copy_manifest_files(root, metadata,
                                  dest_dir, keep_full_path = FALSE,
                                  overwrite = FALSE
                                  )
# manifest_df <- list_manifest_files(root, metadata, dest_dir)
```

```{r validate_crossref, eval=TRUE, include=FALSE}
## Validate metadata against CrossRef and ORCID metadata - will fail rendering on mismatch
## Set strict = FALSE or remove this chunk if you want to skip validation
##
## ORCID validation requires authentication by default (set ORCID_TOKEN environment variable)
## If you want to skip ORCID validation when authentication is not available,
## add: skip_on_auth_error = TRUE
##
## To set up ORCID authentication:
##   1. Run: rorcid::orcid_auth()
##   2. Add ORCID_TOKEN to your .Renviron file
validation_result <- validate_contents_references(
  yml_file = file.path(root, "codecheck.yml"),
  strict = TRUE
  # Uncomment the line below to skip ORCID validation if authentication is unavailable:
  # , skip_on_auth_error = TRUE
)
```

# About CODECHECK

This certificate confirms that the codechecker could independently
reproduce the results of a computational analysis given the data and
code from a third party.  A CODECHECK does not check whether the
original computation analysis is correct.  However, as all materials
required for the reproduction are freely available by following the
links in this document, the reader can then study for themselves the
code and data.

```{r, include=FALSE, eval=FALSE}
# handle Zenodo publication (alternative to codecheck-zenodo.R !)
library("zen4R")
zenodo <- ZenodoManager$new(token = zenodoToken) # assumes Zenodo token is configured via .Renviron
record <- codecheck::get_or_create_zenodo_record(zenodo, codecheck::codecheck_metadata(root))
record <- codecheck::upload_zenodo_metadata(zenodo, record, codecheck::codecheck_metadata(root))
codecheck::upload_zenodo_certificate(zenodo = zenodo, record = record$id, certificate = file.path(root, "codecheck", "codecheck.pdf"))
```
